lead_paragraph: Many political analysts say the president’s slow-motion downfall is tied to an autocratic persona and a go-it-alone work style that has driven away scores of political allies.

byline.contributor: Paula Moura contributed reporting from São Paulo, Brazil, and Eduardo Porter from New York.

headline.print_headline: Former Allies Say Brazil’s Leader Has a Temper That Has Hurt Her
headline.main: Dilma Rousseff, Facing Impeachment in Brazil, Has Alienated Many Allies

snippet: Many political analysts say the president’s slow-motion downfall is tied to an autocratic persona and a go-it-alone work style that has driven away scores of political allies.
abstract: Many analysts say Brazilian Pres Dilma Rousseff, who is fighting off impending impeachment, has autocratic persona and temper that has alienated many former allies and hastened her downfall; her struggle comes amidst nation's dire economic crisis, with millions of middle-class citizens spiraling into poverty, and political corruption scandal involving national oil company.
